bug.short_desc: Applying new table model does not refreshes paneModel

long_desc.thetext: Thanks for the report. Do you have a playground sample for us to reproduce? Or even better a pull request including a unit test?
Playground sample at http://tinyurl.com/mrpclkb I am new to open source development, so I can't supply pull request including a unit test now, sorry.
No problem, the playground sample also helps a lot!

This is a well-known issue. It is highly non-trivial to change the number of columns in a table, as that change would affect many, many objects that were previously created. See this note in qx.ui.table.model.Abstract, function setColumns():
* Note: You can not change the _number_ of columns this way. The number * of columns is highly intertwined in the entire table operation, * and dynamically changing it would require as much work as just * recreating your table. If you must change the number of columns * in a table then you should remove the table and add a new one.
Derrell

Derrell,
Here no changes in existing table model in my sample http://tinyurl.com/mrpclkb
What I am trying to do is to create new one, newTableModel, and "bind" it to existing qx.ui.table.Table

(In reply to comment #5) > Derrell, > > Here no changes in existing table model in my sample http://tinyurl.com/mrpclkb > > What I am trying to do is to create new one, newTableModel, and "bind" it to > existing qx.ui.table.Table
Yup, I understand what you're trying to do. You just can't do it. The inner workings of qx.ui.table.Table don't allow for replacing the table model, particularly with a different number of columns. A table has a single table model which is provided at table-creation time. If you want to change the table model, as your sample is doing, then you should instead remove the old table from the container, create your new model, create a new table with the new model, and add the new table to the container.
Table has some wonderful qualities, but it's not perfect. It's a very, very old widget, and we've learned a lot since then. Unfortunately, some of Table's capabilities don't yet exist in the newer widgets, so Table is still useful for many purposes. You just have to use it according to its capabilities and limitations.
Here's a sample that shows doing what you were trying, the way it must be done with Table.
http://tinyurl.com/o3zrp8y
Derrell

Derrell,
Thank you for your clarification.
I knew about qx.ui.table.model.Abstract restrictions of changing number of columns, but, unfortunately, nothing in _applyTableModel tells me that I cannot change number of columns this way.
